briefdescription.para: Initialize the LameUI core. Here user provides LameUI some RAM to create widgets. If and when RAM is not sufficient, widget creation will fail.

detaileddescription.para: If init fails due to memory allocation problem, returns -1, else returns 0.

parameterdescription.para: an array of uint8_t. this will be used as work area

briefdescription.para: Sets default font of LameUI.

detaileddescription.para: Objects that are created after calling this, will inherit the new default font. But objects created earlier won't update their font automatically.

briefdescription.para: This function updates the UI by reading input and rendering widgets that need rendering.

detaileddescription.para: User must call this function periodically (e.g. every 20ms) in a loop so no input event is missed. Also, LameUI renders only when widgets need rendering. So, draw calls are not wasted.

briefdescription.para: Draw a label widget.
Create a label with initial values.
Set font of a label.

parameterdescription.para: font object. If NULL is passed, default font will be used

briefdescription.para: Set text of a label.
Set forecolor of a label.

simplesect.para: this only changes text color and NOT background color

briefdescription.para: Draw a linechart.
Create a linechart with initial values.
Set number of horizontal and vertical grid lines in a linechart.
Set color of grid lines.
Set visibility of grid lines.
Set color of plot line.

Set whether to apply automatic scaling on the data source or not. If auto scale is enabled, graph will always be in the boundary of drawing area. If auto scale is disabled, user must provide manual range.
Set data range of line chart when auto scaling is disabled.

parameterdescription.para: minimum value of y axis data
maximum value of y axis data

briefdescription.para: Set data source of the line chart.
Draw a button object.
Create a button with initial values.
Set the text of the button's label.
Set alignment of the label text. See: Content alignment flags.

parameterdescription.para: Alignment flags. Allowed values: LUI_ALIGN_LEFT, LUI_ALIGN_CENTER, LUI_ALIGN_RIGHT

briefdescription.para: Set text color of button's label.
Set font of button's label.

parameterdescription.para: font object. If NULL is passed, default font will be used

briefdescription.para: Set other colors of button object.

parameterdescription.para: 16-bit color of button when it's pressed
16-bit color of button when it's selected (hovering)

briefdescription.para: Draw list object.
Create a list object with initial values.
Prepares a list for final render. This function must be called by the user after creating a list/making changes in a list. Else, those changes won't be reflected.
Set maximum item count for a list. The list cannot store items more than this number.

detaileddescription.para: This function must be called once before adding items to the list. Trying to add items before setting max items count will fail. Once max items count is set, it can not be changed anymore. Calling this function again will fail and return -1.

briefdescription.para: Add an item to the end of the list.

detaileddescription.para: Fails if added items exceeds max items count set by lui_list_set_max_items_count() function

briefdescription.para: Remove an item from list at a specific index.
Remove all items from a list.
Get index of selected item of a list.
Set selected item's index in a list.
Get text of a list item by its index.
Set text of a list item by its index.
Set if list is a dropdown or not.

detaileddescription.para: When list is dropdown, it can be expanded/contracted by a button. When a list is not a dropdown, it is always expanded.

briefdescription.para: Expand a dropdown list manually. Works only if list mode is set as dropdown. Otherwise, has no effect.
Sets minimum height of each item in a list.
Set font of list. If none is set, default font is used.
Set alignment of texts in a list.

detaileddescription.para: If alignment is changed after the list is already prepared, call `list_prepare() function again so new alignment is applied to all the items.

parameterdescription.para: Alignment flag. Allowed values are: LUI_ALIGN_LEFT, LUI_ALIGN_CENTER, LUI_ALIGN_RIGHT

briefdescription.para: Sets label text color of navigation buttons of a list. Navigation buttons are used to change current page of list.
Sets label background color of navigation buttons of a list. Navigation buttons are used to change current page of list.
Sets extra colors of list.

parameterdescription.para: 16-bit color of list item when pressed
16-bit color of list item when selected (hovered)

briefdescription.para: Sets current page index of a list. The current page is rendered. Has no effect if index is out of bound.
Adds actual button objects that are created during lui_list_add_item() call. Only called by the library.

parameterdescription.para: button object, which is a list item

briefdescription.para: Adds navigation buttons to list. Only called by the library.
Sets callback function to handle nav button events. Only called by the library.
Draw a switch object.
Create a switch with initial values.

memberdef.argsstring: (lui_obj_t *obj, uint16_t knob_off_color, uint16_t knob_on_color, uint16_t selection_color)
memberdef.name: lui_switch_set_extra_colors

briefdescription.para: Set extra colors of switch object.

parameterdescription.para: 16-bit color of knob when switch is off
16-bit color of knob when switch is on

briefdescription.para: Get value of a switch.

simplesect.para: int8_t value of switch. 0: Off, 1: On, -1: Error.

briefdescription.para: Set value of switch.
Set switch to ON (value: 1)
Set switch to OFF (value: 0)
Draw a checkbox object.
Create a checkbox object with initial values.

memberdef.argsstring: (lui_obj_t *obj, uint16_t bg_checked_color, uint16_t tick_color, uint16_t selection_color)
memberdef.name: lui_checkbox_set_extra_colors

briefdescription.para: Set extra colors of checkbox.

parameterdescription.para: 16-bit background color of checkbox when in checked status
16-bit color of checkbox when it is selected (hovered)

briefdescription.para: Get value of checkbox.

simplesect.para: int8_t Value of checkbox. 0: Unchecked, 1: Checked, -1: Error

briefdescription.para: Set checkbox value.
Set checkbox status to Checked (value: 1)
Set checkbox status to Unchecked (value: 0)
Set label text of a checkbox.
Set label font of a checkbox.
Set label text color of a checkbox.
Draw slider object.
Create a slider object with initial values.

memberdef.argsstring: (lui_obj_t *obj, uint16_t knob_color, uint16_t bg_filled_color, uint16_t selection_color)
memberdef.name: lui_slider_set_extra_colors

briefdescription.para: Set extra colors of slider.

parameterdescription.para: 16-bit background color of the filled section of slider
16-bit color of slider when it's selected (hovered)

briefdescription.para: Set value of slider.
Set minimum and maximum values of slider.
Get value of slider.
Get minimum value of slider's range.
Get maximum value of slider's range.
Draw a buttongrid.

inbodydescription.para: Draw a button only if the btngrid needs full render, or when a buttons index matches an active button's index
This is to handle when a checkable button lost its focus but check state is changed to "Checked". Or, when manually the check state is set

briefdescription.para: Create a buttongrid with initial values.

Set texts of all buttons as a map. The grid is created based on this text map. Each item in the array makes a column and \n (newline) cretaes a row. The text map's last item must be a \0. This marks the end of the grid.

parameterdescription.para: array of strings to be used as text map.

briefdescription.para: Set properties of all buttons as a map.

detaileddescription.para: Each item in the array is a 8-bit value denoting various properties of a button of the buttongrid. The size of array must be same as the number of buttons in the button grid.The structure of a property byte is as follows:

entry.para: 1-15, Setting it to 0 has no effect

detaileddescription.para: Example: To make a checkable button with 3 unit width and to set it to checked status, property byte should be: (1 << 7) | (1 << 4) | 3

briefdescription.para: Set property byte (8 bits) of a particular button in a buttongrid.

parameterdescription.para: index of the button whose property is being set

briefdescription.para: Set text of a particular button in a buttongrid.

parameterdescription.para: index of the button whose text is being set

briefdescription.para: Set the width unit of a particular button in a buttongrid.

parameterdescription.para: index of the button whose width unit is being set

briefdescription.para: Hide/unhide a particular button in the buttongrid.
Set if a particular button is checkable or not.
Set the check status of a particular button in button grid.
Get the index of currently active button, i.e., the button which has the input.

simplesect.para: int16_t Index of active button. -1 if error.

briefdescription.para: Get text of a particular button in a buttongrid.

simplesect.para: const char* text of the button

briefdescription.para: Get the check status of a particular button in button grid.

simplesect.para: int8_t Check status. 0: NOT checked, 1: Checked, -1: Error

briefdescription.para: Set font of button grid text.

memberdef.argsstring: (lui_obj_t *obj, uint16_t btn_color, uint16_t label_color, uint16_t btn_pressed_color)
memberdef.name: lui_btngrid_set_extra_colors

briefdescription.para: Set extra colors of button grid.
Set margin of buttons in a button grid.
Calculate buttongrid area.
Create a keyboard object with initial values.
Keyboard callback function. This function handles all key presses.

detaileddescription.para: If user needs to write their own callback for keyboard, they must call this function from their own callback function.

briefdescription.para: Set the operation mode of keyboard.

detaileddescription.para: For allowed modes, see: Keyboard modes

briefdescription.para: Set font of the keyboard.
Get the text of a key against its index.

simplesect.para: const char* text of the key

briefdescription.para: Set the target textbox of the keyboard. When target textbox is set, the keyboard becomes visible and only the target textbox receives input. To hide the keyboard again, tap/click on the "check/ok" button on the keyboard.
Create a textbox object with initial values.
Set the index (position) of caret (cursor) in the textbox.

detaileddescription.para: Text inputs are inserted at the position of caret.

briefdescription.para: Get the caret index.
Insert a character at the position of caret.

detaileddescription.para: This does NOT change the caret index after the insert operation.

briefdescription.para: Delete a character at the caret index. Does not work when caret is at 0.
Insert a string at the position of caret.

detaileddescription.para: This does NOT change the caret index after the insert operation.

parameterdescription.para: length of the string NOT including the null character

briefdescription.para: Set the text buffer of a textbox. This is where the text is stored.
Set font of the textbox.
Create a panel object with initial values.
Draw apanel.
Create a scene.
Draw scene.
Set the active scene. Only active scene is rendered.
Get the currently active scene.
Create a generic object with default values.
Add a child object to a parent object, thus grouping them together.
Remove an object from its current parent.
Get a particular child by index from a parent.

simplesect.para: lui_obj_t* pointer to child object. Returns NULL if not found

briefdescription.para: Set position of an object.
Set only x position of an object.
Set only y position of an object.
Set drawing area of an object.
Set width of an object.
Set height of an object.
Set border color of an object.
Set border's visibility of an object.
Set background color of an object.
Set event call back function for input handling.

detaileddescription.para: This function is called when an event occurs against this object

parameterdescription.para: function pointer of the callback function

briefdescription.para: Get the input state of an object.
Get input event of an object.
Set visibility of an object.

inbodydescription.para: When object becomes visible, set needs_refresh bit for itself recursively. When object becomes invisble, set needs_refresh bit for its parent recursively.

briefdescription.para: Enable or disble input handling of an object. If disabled, object won't cause input event callback.
Set rendering layer index of an object.

detaileddescription.para: Objects in higher layer will be rendered over the objects in lower layer. If 2 or more objects are in same layer, they're rendered based on the sequence they're added to parent.

briefdescription.para: Get rendering layer index of an object.

simplesect.para: int16_t layer index. Returns -1 if object is NULL

briefdescription.para: Render an object along with all its children (if any)
Render a single object (and NOT its children)
Set needs_refresh flag for an object. This flag determines if onject will be redrawn.

detaileddescription.para: When setting this flag for an object, flags of children and/or parent might also be set, depending on the requirement.

briefdescription.para: Create display driver object.
Register display driver.
Set horizontal and vertical resolution of display.

memberdef.argsstring: (lui_dispdrv_t *dispdrv, void(*draw_pixels_area_cb)(uint16_t x, uint16_t y, uint16_t w, uint16_t h, uint16_t color))
memberdef.name: lui_dispdrv_set_draw_pixels_area_cb

param.type: void(*)(uint16_t x, uint16_t y, uint16_t w, uint16_t h, uint16_t color)

briefdescription.para: Set callback function for drawing an area of pixels with a color.
Set callback function for handling render complete signal. This is optional.

detaileddescription.para: When rendering is completed, LameUI calls this function. It is useful if user was buffering the draw calls rather than directly drawing the pixels on display. Inside the callback functio, user must flush the buffer to display. If user was NOT buffering, then no need to use this callback.

briefdescription.para: Create touch input device object.

simplesect.para: lui_touch_input_dev_t* Created touch input device object

briefdescription.para: Register a touch input device.

briefdescription.para: Check if display driver and pixel drawing callback function are properly registered.
Source FIle of LameUI GUI library. Must include lame_ui.h. No other file is mandatory.
